title: Baa Baa Black Sheep
short_plot_summary: A black sheep is asked if it has any wool, and it replies that it has enough wool for three bags, given to a master, a dame, and a little boy.
explanation: A sheep, representing the black sheep in the nursery rhyme
A black circle, symbolizing the color of the sheep
A gift box, illustrating the wool as a gift
A ball of yarn, signifying the wool mentioned in the rhyme
A girl, representing the little boy who receives the wool as referred to in the song
